abstract: News Analysis; Hillary Clinton faces skepticism about her plan to regulate banks from both her opponent Sen Bernie Sanders and moderators at Democratic debate; Clinton, whose close ties to Wall Street have become issue in campaign, has regulation plan for financial sector that has been widely praised, but she has struggled to present herself as willing to take on banking industry.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton’s sophisticated policy proposals collide with the image that Bernie Sanders supporters and other Democrats have painted of her: Wall Street’s friend and defender.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Is Again Put on the Defensive Over Perceived Ties to Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Clinton Is Again Put on the Defensive Over Perceived Ties to Wall St.

snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s sophisticated policy proposals collide with the image that Bernie Sanders supporters and other Democrats have painted of her: Wall Street’s friend and defender.
